verdict: High CPA for legal lead gen; PMax dominates spend but Search would give better control for legal queries

checks.name: Conversion actions defined
checks.finding: Conversions tracking (24 total) but specific Primary/Secondary setup needs verification

checks.name: Micro vs macro separation
checks.finding: Conversion action types not fully verified — need to check for form fills vs calls vs page views

checks.name: No duplicate counting
checks.finding: PMax and Search may track overlapping conversion actions — needs verification

checks.name: Wasted spend on irrelevant terms
checks.finding: Brand search: $276 for 1 conv ($276 CPA) — low volume brand. PMax: $3,914 for 17 conv ($230 CPA). Incremental Search: $1,289 for 6 conv ($215 CPA)

checks.name: Search term audit recency
checks.finding: Legal keywords are expensive — must ensure search terms match high-intent legal queries, not informational

checks.name: Campaign count per objective
checks.finding: 3 campaigns is lean and appropriate for the budget level

checks.name: Brand vs Non-Brand separation
checks.finding: Brand search separated from non-brand incremental search — good structure

checks.name: PMax present for eligible accounts
checks.finding: PMax for legal services is risky — Display/YouTube placements may waste spend for high-intent legal queries

checks.name: Budget allocation matches priority
checks.finding: PMax gets 71% of spend ($3,914) despite legal being a high-intent vertical where Search typically outperforms

checks.name: Search campaign performance
checks.finding: Incremental Search: 1,787 impr, 88 clicks (4.9% CTR). Brand: 235 impr, 74 clicks (31.5% CTR). Low non-brand volume

checks.name: Keyword coverage
checks.finding: Only 1 non-brand search campaign with limited impression volume. Over-reliance on PMax for non-brand coverage

checks.name: Search impression share
checks.finding: Incremental Search SIS unclear — likely low given limited budget allocation

checks.name: CTR vs industry benchmark
checks.finding: Brand CTR 31.5% is excellent. Incremental Search 4.9% is acceptable for legal

checks.name: PMax brand cannibalization
checks.finding: PMax may be serving on brand terms alongside brand search campaign — verify with asset group reports

checks.name: Smart bidding strategy active
checks.finding: Bidding strategies not fully verified from available data

checks.name: Geographic targeting accuracy
checks.finding: Sunshine Coast targeting — verify radius/location targeting is accurate for service area

checks.name: Ad schedule configured
checks.finding: Legal clients search outside business hours — verify if campaigns run 24/7 and if after-hours tracking is set up

quickWins.action: Shift budget from PMax to Incremental Search — legal is a high-intent vertical where Search outperforms PMax
Add negative keywords to Search campaign for free legal advice, DIY divorce, legal definitions
Add brand exclusion to PMax to prevent brand term cannibalization
Verify conversion tracking — ensure only legitimate leads (calls + form fills) are Primary
Review PMax placement reports — exclude low-quality Display/YouTube placements

items: Audit conversion tracking — ensure only calls and form submissions are Primary
Shift 50%+ of PMax budget to Search for better control over legal queries
Add comprehensive negative keywords for informational legal queries
Expand Incremental Search keywords — add family law practice areas (custody, divorce, property settlement)
Test call-only ads for mobile searchers
Improve ad copy with Sunshine Coast location specifics and practice area callouts
Set up call tracking with minimum duration (e.g., 60 seconds) to filter junk calls
If Search CPA drops below $200, increase budget
Consider LSA for family law — often more cost-effective than Search for legal
Build remarketing audiences for people who visited but didn't convert
Test specific practice area campaigns (divorce, custody, property) separately
